intro: Laelia aurea, commonly known as the golden laelia, is a species of orchid native to the high altitudes of South America. It is characterized by its compact, evergreen growth habit and its ability to thrive in cool, dry environments. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of yellow and orange, often with intricate patterns on the petals. Its pseudobulbs store water and nutrients, allowing it to survive in harsh mountain conditions. Laelia aurea is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its resilience and ornamental beauty.
